answer:
Step 1: Frame‐by‐Frame Analysis  
• Frame 1: Shows the roadway ahead, with a double yellow centerline and a left‐turn arrow marking in the left lane. No clearly visible speed limit sign in this frame.  
• Frame 2: A speed limit sign is plainly visible on the right side of the road; it reads “Speed Limit 30.”  
• Frame 3: The same sign remains in view, confirming “Speed Limit 30.”  
• Frames 4 and 5: The camera’s perspective continues up the road, but no other speed limit signs are seen. The pertinent sign is still visible off to the right in Frame 4.

Step 2: Contextual Reasoning  
Although it is often wise to watch for changing speed zones in a sequence of dashcam frames, in this case the posted speed limit sign in Frames 2 and 3 clearly indicates 30 mph. There is no contradictory signage in subsequent frames, and the roadway does not obviously transition to a different speed zone (for example, from a commercial district to a highway).

Step 3: Match to Answer Choices  
• A (25 mph): Contradicted by the “30 mph” sign.  
• B (30 mph): Matches the observed “Speed Limit 30” sign.  
• C (35 mph) and D (55 mph): Also contradicted by the posted “30 mph” sign.  

Step 4: Provide the Best Answer  
The visible sign in the frames shows that the correct speed limit on this road is 30 mph.

<answer>B</answer>
